headline: Lemonade
description: A cool refreshing summer drink that can be made at any time you have lemons... or limes!
name: Lemonade

recipeInstructions.text: In a 2 quart pitcher, combine the lemon juice, water and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Chill in refrigerator.

review.reviewBody: The first batch I followed the recipe. Not sweet enough - Found 5 Cups of water, 1 Cup of sugar, 1 Cup of lemon juice. Stirred together and chilled. That was good. Made 6 gallons for family reunion.
I used Stevia instead of sugar. If your dehydrated then use the sugar and a 1/8 teaspoon of salt. But I am a diabetic so I use a sugar alternative like Stevia.
This was an amazing recipe! I loved it, i did have to add a bit more sugar but it was still amazing!
This was the perfect spring time drink! I did use the suggestion of other reviewers and made a simple syrup, but that I believed made the process so must faster. Thank you for this submission. ????

The recipe was right on. I wanted to tell you how I made a large quantity of lemonade from a lot of surplus lemons. I juiced two bags of lemons and got 10 cups of juice. To make 2 quarts of lemonade, I used 2 cups of lemon juice and 1 cup of sugar. I brought the sugar and a half a cup of water to a boil then I poured it into a 4 cup freezer container and added a few ice cubes. When it was cool, I added 2 cups of lemon juice. I was able to make a total of five containers of lemon juice for the freezer. Now when I want to make lemonade, I simply defrost one container, pour it into a 2 quart pitcher and add cold water to fill up the pitcher.
Great!! This recipe is AMAZING!! And if your wondering, yes it tastes great with honey instead of sugar
I doubled the recipe! I made a simple syrup out of the sugar and some warm water and the added cold water and the lemon juice!
I made this lemonade for a barbeque and it was gone in 15 minutes. It was that good..
Delicious! I have made this with real lemons and with bottled lemon juice and they both make a great lemonade.
A bit too sour

i really liked it, it is a nice summer drink. But i do think it is just a little sweet :)

I just made for the second time and I think this is a great recipe and it's easy to tweak it to your personal taste and preference. I do follow the advice of another reviewer and make the simple syrup first. I have made it with half the sugar amount and liked it but hubby thought it was too tart. This time I used the full sugar called for but added a little more water so it wouldn't be too sweet. I also divided some of it and added frozen raspberries to see how it would taste...it's turning into a lovely pink lemonade!
Very good!
I love the fact that u can use lime
Simple and delicious. 4 lemons ended up as 1 cup lemon juice for me. Works best over ice as it's strong. Or add an extra cup of water (total 5 cups water).

so so good. in a new england winter we needed a taste of summer. Even my 4 year old loved it and helped with the process. Well done, delicious
This recipe was amazing! I was in a sweet sour mood before I went to bed and had some extra lemons laying around. I decided to make lemonade! My whole family loved it! Perfect lemonade.

I just made a batch of this. I used Meyer lemons and measured the juice. I used 1 cup of lemon juice along with the water and sugar stated in the recipe. It turned out very well. Hope this will be helpful to others.

Tasty & refreshing! I was happy with the outcome, except for the fact that I didn't make enough! I ended up squeezing (fully) 5-6 lemons. And to add an intresting twist to it, I put some vanilla. It was divine!

This recipe is perfect. I had another, which involved slicing the lemon then pounding the slices to release juices, then pouring in water. I could never figure out at what point to remove the slices because the peels would cause the lemonade to get a funny taste. Juicing the lemons first is a better option, and you can add more or less sugar depending on your taste. When I pour the lemon juice in, I pour it through a strainer to remove seeds and pulp. Simple and perfect! Just how I want lemonade to taste.

I used Truvia instead of sugar. I made no other changes. GREAT recipe to make with younger cooks--my son enjoyed juicing each lemon. NOTE: For those looking for an easier way to juice lemons, Grandma taught me to roll them on the counter while gently pushing down with the palm of your hand to get the juices flowing.

Rave reviews. I dissolved the sugar in a little boiling water first, then added it to the total amount of water. As another reviewer said, just taste it and adjust to your liking! It's not brain surgery. I also made ice cubes from the lemonade the day before, and added them so it wouldn't get watered down. *UPDATE* We had some left over and tasted it the next day; it's true, the sliced lemons make it very strong, almost bitter. If you garnish with pretty lemon slices, be sure to add them just before serving, and remove them if you have leftovers.

Super easy and a huge hit for the kids' lemonade stand - we went through four batches! I bumped the sugar up to 2/3 cup because I knew most of the neighborhood kids would want a sweeter lemonade, but will try going with just a half cup next time to up the tart factor.
Delicious! Was considering another recipe that involved using peels, etc, but this was great, tasted just like the state fair lemonade! Thank you for sharing!!
Perfect not too tart not too sweet. I did desolve the sugar with some water on the stovetop before adding it.

I followed the top review to make a simple syrup and that worked out well. I do think I could've added another lemon, but I guess it all depends how juicy the lemons you have are. Don't water this down with ice! Freeze some lemonade into cubes or just pass on ice. Thanks for the recipe, it was nice to make lemonade with my husband and then enjoy it's fresh-squeezed taste together!
I put too much water in it. pretty good:)
I used 10 lemons, about a gallon and a half of water and ice, and enough Splenda to keep the tartness but add some sweet. Just what we needed on a 90-degree day!

This is as simple as it gets. I read several reviews, and the idea of making a simple syrup is ridiculous. The sugar dissolve just fine in the water and with the lemon juice. Because lemons vary so much in size, just taste the darn thing to see if it needs more tang or more sweetness. I always add lemon zest too. This brings out the flavor of the lemon without having to cut into more fresh lemons. Also, it's fine to add lemon juice that isn't freshly squeezed if you think it needs more. We really enjoyed this, very refreshing and super simple.

Wonderful summer lemonade recipe! I fallowed what other reviewers said and made a simple syrup first with the water and sugar, bringing it to a boil and cooling before mixing it all together. My lemons were slightly small, so I adjusted the juice accordingly. Not to sour, not to sweet! Perfect! A thirst quencher!
Very good lemonade!
The BEST lemonade! I use lemon juice when lemons aren't cheep. It always comes out great! :)
I used twice the sugar and it was perfect! My daughter is obsessed with making lemonade. This is going to be the go to recipe. :)

Great basic recipe. Added a little sugar, but it could easily do without the addition. I used smaller lemons, not the huge ones, and I squeezed them over the sugar, let that dissolve, stirred it, then added water and stirred again. Sugar dissolved very quickly and easily.
Simple and perfect.

For this recipe I used 5 large size lemons, and added a 2/3's cup of sugar. I served mine in a chilled glass, as I didn't add any ice. Adding ice quickly dilutes the taste of the lemon flavor. With the modifications I made to this beverage, I would give this recipe 5 stars. This is a good basic recipe to start with, but with everyone's taste preference when it comes to lemonade, (sweet lemonade verses a tart lemonade) I think one should add ingredients that suits their taste buds.

This was ok nothing wow about it. On the upside its a very simple recipe, little time and effort required but id rather put a little more work in for a better tasting drink during the summer. This coconut and lime drink was perfect for me

I didnt have fresh lemons so i used lemon juice. In case anyone needs to know;

4 lemons = between 9 and 12 tablespoons of juice.

I used the recommended amount of lemon juice, and doubled all the other ingredients to make 2 quarts of lemonade. 

PS. A previous reviewer mentioned making the sugar into a syrup. Excellent suggestion. Makes for a much smoother drink.
